about.name: Shweta Pandey
about.title: PhD Student, Indian Institute of Science (IISc)
about.bio: I am a PhD student at IISc working on high-performance systems that span heterogeneous compute and memory hierarchies—focusing on GPU-accelerated storage, persistence. My research explores architectural and software techniques to optimize GPU performance across storage engines and database systems.

projects.name: Optimizing Text-to-Image Generation Inference
projects.description: Architectural and software-level optimizations for accelerating large-scale diffusion transformer pipelines and improving end-to-end inference throughput on GPUs.

projects.name: LLVM Compiler Optimization for Automatic Parallel Code Generation
projects.description: Analyzed and enhanced cost models for OpenMP-based parallelization in LLVM to improve automatic parallel code generation.

projects.name: Non-Volatile Memory (NVM) Database
projects.description: Designed and evaluated storage engines that efficiently leverage NVM for durability and performance, with a focus on GPU-accelerated access and persistency models.

projects.name: Cache Replacement Policies for NVM
projects.description: Conducted a comparative survey of cache replacement policies tailored for non-volatile memory and their impact on persistence-aware caching.

projects.name: Static Analysis for Null Pointer Detection
projects.description: Built a static analysis framework to identify potential null pointer dereferences using data flow and control flow analysis techniques.
